paragraphs.content: Chapter 2
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 2

paragraphs.content: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

paragraphs.content: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
paragraphs.contentHtml: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

paragraphs.content: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

paragraphs.content: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

paragraphs.content: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

paragraphs.content: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

paragraphs.content: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

paragraphs.content: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

paragraphs.content: ¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

paragraphs.content: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

paragraphs.content: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
paragraphs.contentHtml: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

paragraphs.content: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

paragraphs.content: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

paragraphs.content: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

paragraphs.content: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
paragraphs.contentHtml: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

paragraphs.content: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

paragraphs.content: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

paragraphs.content: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

paragraphs.content: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

paragraphs.content: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

paragraphs.content: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
